name: Hill Toggle
author: Timothy S. Gardner <timothyg@bu.edu>
Charles R. Cantor <crcantor@bu.edu>
James J. Collins <jimjc@mit.edu>
description: The toggle switch is a gene regulatory network, that models the interaction of two proteins. Protein 1 (`p1´) represses the expression of protein 2 (`p2´) and vice versa, leading to a bimodal steady-state distribution and a transient switching behavior. See [1] for more information.

properties.name: Switching
properties.description: Whether the probability of protein 2 concentration being greater 10 after <= 10 time units is larger than 5e-08

properties.name: RareEvent
properties.description: Whether the probability of protein 1 and 2 concentration being greater 5 after <= 10 time units is larger than 1e-33

conversion.note: since PRISM files with unbounded integers can currently not be parsed, bounds have been introduced manually and removed afterwards
